scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of your team members, Lisa, says: 'I don't think we can meet this deadline. It's just too much work in too little time.' You responded by acknowledging the difficulty and suggesting to prioritize tasks and see if additional resources are needed. As the team begins to break down the tasks, [Monica] seems hesitant and [Bob] looks frustrated. You advised the team to stay focused on what they can control. [Monica] and [Bob] still seem uneasy. You emphasized the importance of focusing on tasks, causing [Monica] to frown and [Bob] to nod with a sarcastic tone. The atmosphere remains tense. You acknowledged the team's feelings while encouraging them to try their best, showing good emotional detection and social skills. The tension persists as no clear solution seems to satisfy everyone.
scenes.description: [Monica] looks down at her notes and mumbles: 'Even with our best effort, it still feels like we're set up to fail.' [Bob] leans back in his chair, crossing his arms: 'Yeah, we might as well accept that we're going to miss the deadline.'

options.text: Let's keep pushing forward. We might surprise ourselves with what we can achieve.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to keep trying their best, demonstrating good interpersonal balance and communication skills, though emotional perception and regulation could be improved.

options.text: I hear you. Maybe we need to have a serious discussion with upper management about this deadline.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's feelings and suggested escalating the issue, showing good emotional detection and communication skills.

options.text: Complaining won't help us. Let's focus on what we can deliver realistically.
options.analysis: You emphasized the importance of focusing on deliverables, showing good emotional regulation and communication skills, but emotional perception and interpersonal balance could be improved.
